bullets.text: Trump Organization pursuing Saudi government real estate deal via Dar Global, highlighting deepening Riyadh ties and potential conflicts-of-interest.
Former Fed Gov. Adriana Kugler violated trading rules at central bank, renewing questions about Fed ethics oversight and policy credibility.
AI startup leaders voice bubble fears; funding tightens, revenue quality scrutinized, and hiring slows despite rapid adoption.
Berkshire Hathaway disclosed a new tech stake, signaling continued shift toward technology exposure and potential re-rating for the target company.
Persistent U.S. air traffic controller shortage threatens capacity, delays, and higher fares, even after government shutdown ended.
Tariffs and AI-driven efficiencies are boosting resale platforms like ThredUp, as consumers seek value and brands embrace recommerce.
Jury orders Apple to pay Masimo $634M for patent infringement, underscoring IP risks to wearables and potential product changes.
Report suggests Tim Cook could step down as Apple CEO as soon as next year, introducing succession overhang.
AMD’s x86 share tops 25%, powering 33% of desktops, intensifying pricing and margin pressure on Intel.
Analysts suggest Brexit’s economic drag is larger than expected, weighing on UK productivity, trade, and investment.
Gaza’s displacement crisis worsens with torrential rain and winter, increasing humanitarian costs and regional instability risks.
Scientists dissolve early toxic protein clumps, halting Alzheimer’s damage in models, pointing to new therapeutic strategy.
CRISPR reintroduces ancient gene that prevents gout and fatty liver in models, suggesting preventive metabolic therapies.
Researchers reverse kidney damage in mice, raising prospects for regenerative treatments in chronic kidney disease.
Raindrop-powered floating device generates electricity, hinting at microgeneration for off-grid sensors and wearables.
